bugs.title: CVE-2021-41688 dcmtk: a double free allows for a DoS [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41688 dcmtk: a double free allows for a DoS [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41688 dcmtk: a double free allows for a DoS

long_desc.thetext:
The object in the program is free but its address is still used in other locations. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program will incur a double free. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Reference:

https://github.com/DCMTK/dcmtk/commit/a9697dfeb672b0b9412c00c7d36d801e27ec85cb

Created dcmtk tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2106315]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2106314]

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41690 dcmtk: sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program can incur a memory leak [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41690 dcmtk: sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program can incur a memory leak [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41690 dcmtk: sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program can incur a memory leak

long_desc.thetext:
The malloced memory for storing all file information are recorded in a global variable LST and are not freed properly. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program can incur a memory leak. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Reference:

https://github.com/DCMTK/dcmtk/commit/a9697dfeb672b0b9412c00c7d36d801e27ec85cb

Created dcmtk tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41687 dcmtk: a memory leak allows a DoS [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41687 dcmtk: a memory leak allows a DoS [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41687 dcmtk: a memory leak allows a DoS

long_desc.thetext:
The program malloc a heap memory for parsing data, but does not free it when error in parsing. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program incur the memory leak. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Reference:

https://github.com/DCMTK/dcmtk/commit/a9697dfeb672b0b9412c00c7d36d801e27ec85cb

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41689 dcmtk: a head-based overflow may lead to DoS [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41689 dcmtk: a head-based overflow may lead to DoS [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41689 dcmtk: a head-based overflow may lead to DoS

long_desc.thetext:
Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program, it would query its database and copy the result even if the result is null, which can incur a head-based overflow. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Reference:

https://github.com/DCMTK/dcmtk/commit/5c14bf53fb42ceca12bbcc0016e8704b1580920d

Created dcmtk tracking bugs for this issue:

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-43272 dcmtk: memory leak via the T_ASC_Association object.

OFFIS DCMTK's (All versions prior to 3.6.7) service class provider (SCP) is vulnerable to path traversal, allowing an attacker to write DICOM files into arbitrary directories under controlled names. This could allow remote code execution.

OFFIS DCMTK's (All versions prior to 3.6.7) service class user (SCU) is vulnerable to relative path traversal, allowing an attacker to write DICOM files into arbitrary directories under controlled names. This could allow remote code execution.

Created dcmtk tracking bugs for this issue:

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-2121 dcmtk: NULL pointer dereference that could lead to a DoS [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-2121 dcmtk: NULL pointer dereference that could lead to a DoS [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-2121 dcmtk: NULL pointer dereference that could lead to a DoS

long_desc.thetext: OFFIS DCMTK's (All versions prior to 3.6.7) has a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability while processing DICOM files, which may result in a denial-of-service condition.

Created dcmtk tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2173045]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2173044

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2173044,2173045

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

I gather that most or all of these EPEL CVE’s would be handled if we just updated to 3.6.7 in those branches (from 3.6.4 or 3.6.6).

Do you know if patch-release updates are generally compatible in this package?

(In reply to Ben Beasley from comment #2)
> I gather that most or all of these EPEL CVE’s would be handled if we just
> updated to 3.6.7 in those branches (from 3.6.4 or 3.6.6).
> 
> Do you know if patch-release updates are generally compatible in this
> package?

Answering my own question, it looks like the .so version was bumped at least from 3.6.6 to 3.6.7, so that would be a “no.”

I was able to backport the necessary commits to resolve the outstanding CVEs.

https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/dcmtk/pull-request/8
https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/dcmtk/pull-request/9

notes:
This update contains several high and critical security fixes.

- CVE-2021-41687/CVE-2021-41688/CVE-2021-41690
- CVE-2021-41689
- CVE-2022-2119/CVE-2022-2120/CVE-2022-2121
- CVE-2022-43272

It also switches to use bundled charls v1 to match the behavior in Fedora.
